title: Iran Nobel laureate taken to hospital after 'violent arrest'
description: Narges Mohammadi told her family in a phone call that she was beaten on the head and neck by plainclothes agents in Mashhad last week.
content:
Iranian Nobel Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi was taken to hospital after being beaten when she was arrested last week, her family says.
The 53-year-old human rights activist told them in a phone call on Sunday that she was brought to an emergenc... [3194 chars]

title: Venezuela accuses Trinidad and Tobago of taking part in US seizure of oil tanker
description: Maduro regime accuses Caribbean nation of participating in ‘theft of Venezuelan oil’ as tensions mount in region
content: Venezuela has accused the government of Trinidad and Tobago of taking part in the US seizure of an oil tanker off Venezuela’s coast last week, as Donald Trump’s four-month pressure campaign against Nicolás Maduro continues to reverberate across the r... [4119 chars]

title: Formal bid to extend Northumberland Line to Newbiggin
description: The council wants funding for Newbiggin-by-the-Sea to be added to the Northumberland Line.
content:
A formal bid to extend a railway line which has seen more than 900,000 passenger journeys in the year since it reopened has been submitted.
Northumberland County Council asked the North East Combined Authority to extend the Northumberland Line, which... [887 chars]

title: Manchester Rabbi's cousin killed in Bondi Beach terror attack
description: New pictures of Rabbi Eli Schlanger are released by his family who say he was "a phenomenal" person.
content:
A Rabbi has spoken of how he texted his Australia-based cousin to make sure he was safe following the Bondi Beach terror attack, before finding out he had been killed.

title: Raynor Winn denies new allegations of theft from family members
description: The Salt Path author has rejected new accusations from a niece alleging she took money from relatives, describing the claims as part of a ‘false narrative’ about her life
content:
Raynor Winn, the author of The Salt Path, has denied fresh allegations that she stole money from members of her family, describing the claims as part of a “false narrative” about her life.
